alert.note: Alert for Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 9:18PM EST until February 05 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Rough River near Dundee affecting Ohio County. .Heavy rain from the past few days will cause the river to rise.PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Flood Advisory means minor flooding is possible and rivers are forecast to exceed bankfull. If you are in the advisory area remain alert to possible flooding, or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning. && ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Rough River near Dundee. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, County roads between Dundee and Narrows flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CST Friday the stage was 24.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below 23 feet Saturday morning. - Action stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
